audio_description: This biryani is quite popular in Bangalore, and in restaurants, it is served in bowls made from palm tree leaves, which are called "donne." So let’s see what ingredients we need to make this tasty and easy biryani.

audio_description: Its taste is even better than basmati rice. We will use a large chopped tomato, 1 cup mint leaves, 1 cup coriander, 10–12 green chilies, ½ cup yogurt (about 100 grams). For whole spices: 1 tsp cumin, 2 bay leaves...

audio_description: 10 whole black peppers, and 2 star anise (also called badiyan phool). We also need 3 large onions, finely sliced, 1 cup oil, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 3½ tsp salt, and 1 tsp garam masala powder.

audio_description: First, we will marinate the chicken. Wash it well and add 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, and ½ cup yogurt. Mix everything well and let the chicken rest for an hour.

audio_description: We’ll use the remaining salt and ginger-garlic paste while making the biryani. In a blender jar, add coriander, mint leaves, and green chilies to make a paste. In some places, fenugreek leaves are also used in this paste...

audio_description: For dum, place a tawa (griddle) on the stove and place the biryani pot on it. Cook on low flame for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, turn off the flame but let it rest for another 5–10 minutes.

audio_description: I’m serving this Donne Biryani in palm leaf bowls — just like in restaurants. Even if you don’t have these, you can serve it on any plate. You can enjoy this biryani for lunch or dinner.
